title: 107_s1553
content: The Act titled as the "Economic Stimulus Through Bonus Depreciation Act of 2001" allows for a bonus depreciation allowance for certain business assets. The "Economic Stimulus Through Bonus Depreciation Act of 2001" introduces a bonus allowance for qualified business assets under Section 168 of the Internal Revenue Code. This allows for a 50% depreciation deduction of the adjusted basis of the property in the year it is placed in service, with subsequent years following regular depreciation rules. The "Economic Stimulus Through Bonus Depreciation Act of 2001" allows for a 50% depreciation deduction of the adjusted basis of qualified property in the year it is placed in service. The adjusted basis cannot exceed the original cost reduced by any previous deductions. Qualified property includes assets with original use starting on or after September 11. The "Economic Stimulus Through Bonus Depreciation Act of 2001" allows for a 50% depreciation deduction of qualified property acquired between September 11, 2001, and July 1, 2002, and placed in service before January 1, 2003. The "Economic Stimulus Through Bonus Depreciation Act of 2001" allows for a 50% depreciation deduction of qualified property acquired between September 11, 2001, and July 1, 2002, and placed in service before January 1, 2003. Exceptions include alternative depreciation property and the ability to make an election out for any class of property in a taxable year. The term 'qualified property' excludes repaired or reconstructed property. Special rules apply to self-constructed property for original use. The taxpayer meets requirements if they start manufacturing, constructing, or producing property between September 11, 2001, and January 1, 2003. Sale-leasebacks have specific conditions for property originally placed in service after September 11, 2001. The taxpayer can qualify for certain deductions if they start manufacturing, constructing, or producing property within a specific timeframe. Sale-leasebacks have conditions for property placed in service after a certain date. The deduction for automobiles and listed property is adjusted accordingly. The deduction for listed property affects recapture amounts under section 280F(b)(2). Additionally, the deduction under section 168(k) is allowed against alternative minimum tax. Amendment to section 56(a)(1)(A) of the Code allows for property placed in service after September 11, 2001, to be eligible for deductions.
